Detailed Description

Page class.

This class is used to create and manipulate pages.

License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Link:
http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
Copyright:
2009 David Singer
Author:
David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
Version:
1.8.4

Definition at line 16 of file Page.php.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Boo_Page::__construct ( $  user = false  ) 

Default constructor.

If the user is set a call to Boo_Page::setUser() is made with the supplied $user.

Parameters:
object $user[optional] The user.
Returns:
void This function does not set a return value.

Boo_Page::forceSsl (  ) 

Redirects users to the SSL version of the current page.

Function is ignored unless BOO_PRODUCTION is set to TRUE because SSL is rarely used in development enviroments.

Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if page is already secured with SSL.

Definition at line 254 of file Page.php.

References isSsl(), and redirect().

$  charset = 'utf-8' 
) [static]

Sets the Content-Type header.

This function is provided as a convenience.

Parameters:
string $contentType The content type, defaults to text/html.
string $charset The charset, defaults to utf-8.
Returns:
bool TURE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

$  contentType = 'text/html',
$  charset = 'utf-8' 
) [static]

Sets the headers for no cache.

This is usefull when making AJAX requests.

Parameters:
string $contentLength The content length, defaults to not set.
string $contentType The content type, defaults to text/html.
string $charset The charset, defaults to utf-8.
Returns:
bool Returns TURE if successful, FALSE otherwise.

Boo_Page::htmlConditionalCss (  ) 

Creates conditional comments for IE.

Works with:

  • IE 6 = /css/ie6.css
  • IE 7 = /css/ie7.css
  • IE 8 = /css/ie8.css
Returns:
string Returns HTML conditional comments.

Boo_Page::login ( $  username = false,
$  password = false,
$  redirect = true 
)

Login the user.

Parameters:
string $username[optional] The username. If it is not set then Boo_User::getUsername() will be used.
string $password[optional] The password. If it is not set then Boo_User::getPassword() will be used.
mixed $redirect[optional] Redirect user to default URL if TRUE or to the value of $redirect if not FALSE.
Returns:
Returns TRUE if login was successful, FALSE otherwise.

Boo_Page::requireAuth ( $  redirect = true  ) 

Require authorization.

Parameters:
mixed $redirect[optional] Redirect user to default URL if TRUE or to the value of $redirect if not FALSE.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE if authorized, FALSE otherwise. If $redirect is FALSE and authorization fails program will exit.

Definition at line 557 of file Page.php.

Boo_Page::setUser ( $  user  )  [private]

Sets the pages user.

This function is used to set the page user. The object should be of a type derived from Boo_User. It will overide the existing user. This is usefull if you want to extend the Boo_User object while retaning the functionality of the Boo_Page object. This method is called by the constructor.

See also:
Boo_User::__construct()
Parameters:
object $user The user.
Returns:
bool Function always returns TURE.

Definition at line 168 of file Page.php.

References $user.

Referenced by __construct().

Member Data Documentation

Boo_Page::$browser

Boo_Browser object.

This object is automatically initialized by the constructor if BOO_BROWSER is set to TRUE, otherwise $browser will be false.

Definition at line 23 of file Page.php.

Boo_Page::$msgError

Boo_Dialog_MessageBox object.

This object is automatically initialized by the constructor. Message box will contain any error messages generated by the page.

Definition at line 37 of file Page.php.

Boo_Page::$msgGlobal

Boo_Dialog_MessageBox object.

This object is automatically initialized by the constructor. Message box will contain any global messages generated by the page.

Definition at line 51 of file Page.php.

Boo_Page::$msgSuccess

Boo_Dialog_MessageBox object.

This object is automatically initialized by the constructor. Message box will contain any success messages generated by the page.

Boo_Page::$msgWarning

Boo_Dialog_MessageBox object.

This object is automatically initialized by the constructor. Message box will contain any warning messages generated by the page.

Boo_Page::$user

Boo_User object.

This object is automatically initialized by the constructor. User represents the current user accessing the page.
